name: places/ChIJ58DNYVRYwokRUvOU0Ih8tfQ
formattedAddress: 235 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 235 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Major 1,156-seat Broadway venue dating back to 1917 that plays host to shows with big-name stars.

originalText.text: Sadly, anyone over 5’10” will not fit in the seating here. This theater sacrifices comfort for capacity. The irony is the majority of seats on a Saturday night show remained empty. Visibility of the stage is fine, but you’ll just have to get used to bruised shins and a stranger’s skull in between your knees, and likely someone else’s knees at your ears. Maybe you’re into that.

text.text: Sadly, anyone over 5’10” will not fit in the seating here. This theater sacrifices comfort for capacity. The irony is the majority of seats on a Saturday night show remained empty. Visibility of the stage is fine, but you’ll just have to get used to bruised shins and a stranger’s skull in between your knees, and likely someone else’s knees at your ears. Maybe you’re into that.

originalText.text:
I want to make my review about the theater itself, but is hard when the show I saw there (A Beautiful Noise) was just amazing in every way - I felt every single emotion. If you go, bring tissues.

But back to the theater!  It is beautiful and the seats were comfortable. As is the case with many of the theaters on Broadway, accessibility is impacted by the layout (restrooms are down a flight of steps from the orchestra area). But I also saw attentive staff ready to assist any one requiring assistance.

Speaking of restrooms and staff, the individual they had directing traffic in the women’s room the day I was there deserves a raise! If you’ve ever tried to use a women’s restroom after a show, you know the line gets long and people sometimes get a little edgy (for obvious reasons). The attendant was cordial, kept things moving, and made the whole experience just so much better!

Thank you all around! I would’ve watched that show outside in the rain and loved it just as much but the attention to detail in the Broadhurst Theatre definitely enhanced the experience.

If you are reading this and haven’t seen A Beautiful Noise, go get a ticket right now!

originalText.text: We attended a performance of Beautiful Noise, a Neil Diamond play, at the Broadhurst Theater. The venue, while not excessively large, provided comfortable seating. However, the downstairs restrooms were relatively small, leading to long lines during intermission. Our seats in the right orchestra area had a good view of the stage.

However, the downstairs restrooms were relatively small, leading to long lines during intermission. Our seats in the right orchestra area had a good view of the stage.

originalText.text: The theater is easy to find. Small like any otjer theater in NYC. Rows are too close and you have to stand whenever one wants to go out.

text.text: The theater is easy to find. Small like any otjer theater in NYC. Rows are too close and you have to stand whenever one wants to go out.

originalText.text: We came to see the Neil Diamond musical show and it was simply PHENOMENAL. My son and I enjoyed everything about the show from start to finish. I’m glad that we were able to attend this show.
